instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid on board.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> (pin 2/F5200) got 0V (.473 in diode mode)
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> 0V and .340 in diode mode

FF200/1 both got 5V on both sides.
PP3V3_UPC0/<SIGNAL>1_LDO</SIGNAL> correct diode mode and voltage when charger connected
PP1V5_UPC0/1_LDO_CORE correct diode mode and voltage when charger connected
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC0</SIGNAL>/1 got 5V

Wont go into DFU mode.

Replaced just in case both <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> and still the same issue.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> had 0V.
Checked input voltage on <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> and there was 5V so replaced <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> and all working fine now.
Thanks for help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
threads.message:
Keep the fuse out.
Then post <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> basic voltages: <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, IRQ*, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
threads.message:
Wait, the machine is now fixed?
I didn't correctly understand your previous post, I think...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.04A
threads.message: Sorry. Yes, machine is working fine with new <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>
